titles.title: Alternative perspective on gauged lepton number and implications for collider physics

abstracts.value: A new anomaly-free gauged <math><mi>U</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><msub><mo>)</mo><mo>ℓ</mo></msub></math> lepton-number model is studied. Two Standard Model (SM) lepton generations acquire the same but oppositive-sign <math><mi>U</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><msub><mo>)</mo><mo>ℓ</mo></msub></math> charges, while four exotic chiral leptons cancel the anomalies of the remaining lepton family. We discuss a simplified case which has the universal Yukawa couplings. It agrees with all the experimental constraints and predicts <math><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>e</mi></msub></mrow></math>, <math><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>μ</mi></msub><mo>≪</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>τ</mi></msub></math>, and the latter is of the electroweak scale. Due to the interference between the SM and <math><mi>U</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><msub><mo>)</mo><mo>ℓ</mo></msub></math> gauge interactions, this model robustly predicts that <math><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow></math>, <math><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></math>, <math><mrow><mi>τ</mi></mrow></math> have distinctive forward-backward asymmetries at the <math><msup><mi>e</mi><mo>+</mo></msup><msup><mi>e</mi><mo>−</mo></msup></math> colliders. It can be searched for at the <math><msup><mi>e</mi><mo>+</mo></msup><msup><mi>e</mi><mo>−</mo></msup></math> machine with <math><mo>∼</mo><mi>TeV</mi></math> center-of-mass energy and an integrated luminosity <math><mo>∼</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>b</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>.
